headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Trump‚Äôs New Deal
summary: President Trump said he wants to do more deals like the government‚Äôs equity investment in Intel, which he posited as a new way of doing industrial policy.  The U.S. converted funds previously allocated for manufacturing expansion under a 2022 statute into a 9.9% stake in the chip maker.  The government also got a five-year warrant under which it could get another 5% if Intel spins out or sells off its manufacturing operations.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Trump‚Äôs New Deal
content.summary: President Trump said he wants to do more deals like the government‚Äôs equity investment in Intel, which he posited as a new way of doing industrial policy.  The U.S. converted funds previously allocated for manufacturing expansion under a 2022 statute into a 9.9% stake in the chip maker.  The government also got a five-year warrant under which it could get another 5% if Intel spins out or sells off its manufacturing operations.

headline: Trading Day: Pivoting on Powell's pivot
summary: Investors on Monday wound back some of Friday's sharp market swings sparked by Fed Chair Jerome Powell's dovish pivot, a reversal that saw the dollar spike higher, Wall Street close lower and the U.S. yield curve flatten.  In my column today, I look at Powell's Jackson Hole speech on Friday, and argue that his opening the door to a rate cut next month is not a sign that he caved to political pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump.  World's central bankers fear being caught in Fed's storm  2.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper To Acquire Peet's Coffee Parent. They Won't Stay Together For Long.
summary: In one of the largest buyouts in the U.S. this year, Keurig Dr Pepper agreed to acquire the owner of Peet's Coffee in a deal valued at more than $18 billion.  KDP plans to eventually split the two companies into two publicly traded companies.  KDP will pay Amsterdam-based JDE Peet's shareholders 31.85 euros, or about $37, per share in cash.

content.title: Keurig Dr Pepper To Acquire Peet's Coffee Parent. They Won't Stay Together For Long.
content.summary: In one of the largest buyouts in the U.S. this year, Keurig Dr Pepper agreed to acquire the owner of Peet's Coffee in a deal valued at more than $18 billion.  KDP plans to eventually split the two companies into two publicly traded companies.  KDP will pay Amsterdam-based JDE Peet's shareholders 31.85 euros, or about $37, per share in cash.

headline: Why Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of beverage company Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ:KDP) fell 8.2% in the morning session after it announced a plan to acquire JDE Peet's for approximately $18.4 billion and then split into two independent companies. The beverage giant announced a definitive agreement to acquire Dutch coffee firm JDE Peet's in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $18.4 billion.

headline: S&P puts Keurig Dr Pepper on negative credit watch
summary: (Reuters) -Ratings agency S&P Global put a negative credit outlook on U.S. soft drinks giant¬†Keurig Dr Pepper after the company announced Monday it will buy Dutch coffee group JDE Peet's.  In a Monday note accompanying their credit outlook downturn on the popular soda seller, S&P analysts highlighted the increased debt profile of Keurig following the announcement of its $18 billion takeover of Peet's.  The analysts noted Keurig's post-deal leverage will likely lie in the mid-to-high 5x range, well above its 4x leverage at the end of June.

content.title: S&P puts Keurig Dr Pepper on negative credit watch
content.summary: (Reuters) -Ratings agency S&P Global put a negative credit outlook on U.S. soft drinks giant¬†Keurig Dr Pepper after the company announced Monday it will buy Dutch coffee group JDE Peet's.  In a Monday note accompanying their credit outlook downturn on the popular soda seller, S&P analysts highlighted the increased debt profile of Keurig following the announcement of its $18 billion takeover of Peet's.  The analysts noted Keurig's post-deal leverage will likely lie in the mid-to-high 5x range, well above its 4x leverage at the end of June.

headline: Stocks slip, Nvidia earnings, Keurig Dr Pepper's deal: 3 Things

One of the big stories this week will be Nvidia's (NVDA) earnings. The chip giant will report its second quarter earnings on Wednesday, Aug. 27, after the markets close. Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) announced it will acquire JDE Peet's (JDEP.AS, JDEPY) for about $18 billion. After the acquisition is completed, the company will split itself into a beverage company and a coffee company. headline: Factbox-Inner workings of Keurig Dr Pepper's $18 billion move for JDE Peet's
summary: The break-up of the combined entity will take place via a spin-off of Global Coffee Co to KDP's shareholders by the end of 2026. The transaction will result in cost savings and value creation of $400 million over three years. JAB Holding, which owns 4.4% in KDP as well as around 68% in JDE Peet's via its Acorn division, will hold nearly 5% in both entities following the spin-off, it said.

content.title: Factbox-Inner workings of Keurig Dr Pepper's $18 billion move for JDE Peet's
content.summary: The break-up of the combined entity will take place via a spin-off of Global Coffee Co to KDP's shareholders by the end of 2026. The transaction will result in cost savings and value creation of $400 million over three years. JAB Holding, which owns 4.4% in KDP as well as around 68% in JDE Peet's via its Acorn division, will hold nearly 5% in both entities following the spin-off, it said.

thumbnail.caption: Cans of Dr. Pepper soda are displayed on June 03, 2024 in San Anselmo, California. Dr. Pepper has tied Pepsi for the second most popular soft drink in the United States behind Coca-Cola.

headline: Dr Pepper will unwind its merger with Keurig 7 years ago after buying Peet's for $18 billion
summary: Less than a decade after their merger, Keurig and Dr Pepper plan to become separate companies again.  Keurig Dr Pepper said Monday it is buying the owner of Peet's Coffee for $18 billion (15.7 billion euro).  Then it will break itself in two, with one company selling coffee and the other selling cold beverages like Snapple, Dr Pepper, 7UP and energy drinks.

headline: Dr Pepper strikes $18 bln deal to buy Dutch coffee firm JDE Peet's
summary: STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is set to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.The deal is valued at just over $18 billion.JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet‚Äôs Coffee and international brands like L‚ÄôOr and Douwe Egbert - is currently valued at about $15 billion.Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.After combining, the two firms say they will separate the coffee and beverage units.JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.They‚Äôve jumped after volatile weather took a toll on Arabica and Robusta bean production.The Dutch firm has also warned that U.S. coffee prices could jump this year as a result of Donald Trump‚Äôs 50% levy on beans imported from Brazil.Keurig has warned that its coffee segment will see subdued performance for the rest of the year as a result of such factors.The firm last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.Shares in JDE Peet's jumped around 18% in early Amsterdam trade on Monday, on track for their best day on record.

content.title: Dr Pepper strikes $18 bln deal to buy Dutch coffee firm JDE Peet's
content.description:
STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is set to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.

The deal is valued at just over $18 billion.

JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet‚Äôs Coffee and international brands like L‚ÄôOr and Douwe Egbert - is currently valued at about $15 billion.

Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.

After combining, the two firms say they will separate the coffee and beverage units.

JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.

That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.

They‚Äôve jumped after volatile weather took a toll on Arabica and Robusta bean production.

The Dutch firm has also warned that U.S. coffee prices could jump this year as a result of Donald Trump‚Äôs 50% levy on beans imported from Brazil.

Keurig has warned that its coffee segment will see subdued performance for the rest of the year as a result of such factors.

The firm last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.

It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.

Shares in JDE Peet's jumped around 18% in early Amsterdam trade on Monday, on track for their best day on record.¬†
content.summary: STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is set to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.The deal is valued at just over $18 billion.JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet‚Äôs Coffee and international brands like L‚ÄôOr and Douwe Egbert - is currently valued at about $15 billion.Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.After combining, the two firms say they will separate the coffee and beverage units.JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.They‚Äôve jumped after volatile weather took a toll on Arabica and Robusta bean production.The Dutch firm has also warned that U.S. coffee prices could jump this year as a result of Donald Trump‚Äôs 50% levy on beans imported from Brazil.Keurig has warned that its coffee segment will see subdued performance for the rest of the year as a result of such factors.The firm last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.Shares in JDE Peet's jumped around 18% in early Amsterdam trade on Monday, on track for their best day on record.

headline: Dr Pepper maker nears $18 bln deal for coffee company JDE Peet's: WSJ
summary: STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is nearing an $18 billion deal to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.That‚Äôs according to Wall Street Journal reports on Sunday.JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet's Coffee and international brands like L'Or and Douwe Egberts - is currently valued at about $15 billion.Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.After combining, the report says the two firms will separate the coffee and beverage units.Neither company would immediately comment on the report.JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.Keurig Dr Pepper last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.

content.title: Dr Pepper maker nears $18 bln deal for coffee company JDE Peet's: WSJ
content.description:
STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is nearing an $18 billion deal to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.

That‚Äôs according to Wall Street Journal reports on Sunday.

JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet's Coffee and international brands like L'Or and Douwe Egberts - is currently valued at about $15 billion.

Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.

After combining, the report says the two firms will separate the coffee and beverage units.

Neither company would immediately comment on the report.

JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.

That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.

Keurig Dr Pepper last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.

It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.
content.summary: STORY: The firm behind Dr Pepper drinks is nearing an $18 billion deal to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet‚Äôs.That‚Äôs according to Wall Street Journal reports on Sunday.JDE Peet‚Äôs - known for Peet's Coffee and international brands like L'Or and Douwe Egberts - is currently valued at about $15 billion.Keurig Dr Pepper is worth more than three times that figure.After combining, the report says the two firms will separate the coffee and beverage units.Neither company would immediately comment on the report.JDE Peet‚Äôs lifted its annual forecasts last month, after beating expectations for half-yearly results.That‚Äôs thanks to sales growth that defied already high coffee prices.Keurig Dr Pepper last year bought a 60% stake in energy-drink maker Ghost for almost $1 billion.It plans to purchase the rest in 2028, as part of moves to enhance its portfolio of drinks.
